alert.note: Alert for Columbia (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of western Massachusetts and east central New York, including the following counties, in western Massachusetts, Berkshire. In east central New York, Columbia. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Great Barrington, Sheffield, Housatonic, Ashley Falls, Stockbridge, Alford, Newsboy Statue, Berkshire Heights, Brookside, Egremont Plain, South Egremont, Belcher Square, Van Deusenville, North Egremont, Risingdale, Williamsville, Glendale, Rockdale Mills, East Hillsdale and Hartsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
